content: प्रतिष्ठा {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To stand firm, be established. {@--2@} To be supported. {@--3@} To rest or depend upon. {@--4@} To stay, abide, be situated. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To place firmly on, station. {@--2@} To set up, erect, establish. {@--3@} To install, inaugurate (on a throne). {@--4@} To entrust with, consign to. {@--5@} To offer, present.

प्रतिष्ठा {@--1@} Resting, remaining, situation, position; अपौरुषेयप्रतिष्ठं <ls>Māl. 9</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 6.</ls> {@--2@} A house, residence, home, habitation; <ls>R. 6. 21</ls>; <ls n="R.">14. 5.</ls> {@--3@} Fixity, stability, strength, permanence, firm basis; अप्रतिष्ठे रघुज्येष्ठे का प्रतिष्ठा कुलस्य नः <ls>U. 5. 25</ls>; अत्र खलु मे वंशप्रतिष्ठा <ls>Ś. 7</ls>; वंशः प्रतिष्ठां नीतः <ls>K. 280</ls>; <ls>Śi. 2. 34.</ls> {@--4@} Basis, foundation, site; as in गृहप्रतिष्ठा. {@--5@} A prop, stay, support; (hence) an object of glory, a distinguished ornament; त्यक्ता मया नाम कुलप्रतिष्ठा <ls>Ś. 6. 23</ls>; द्वे प्रतिष्ठे कुलस्य नः <ls n="Ś.">3. 21</ls>; <ls>Ku. 7. 27</ls>; <ls>Mv. 7. 21.</ls> {@--6@} High position, preeminence, high authority; <ls>Mu. 2. 5.</ls> {@--7@} Fame, glory, renown, celebrity; मा निषाद प्रतिष्ठां त्वमगमः शाश्वतीः समाः <ls>Rām.</ls> (= <ls>U. 2. 5.</ls>). {@--8@} Installation, inauguration; <ls>Mu. 1. 14.</ls> {@--9@} Attainment of a desired object, accomplishment, fulfilment (of one's desire); औत्सुक्यमात्रमवसादयति प्रतिष्ठा <ls>Ś. 5. 6.</ls> {@--10@} Tranquillity, rest, repose. {@--11@} A receptacle. {@--12@} The earth. {@--13@} The consecration of an idol or image. {@--14@} A limit, boundary. {@--15@} The foot.
